text:
Since I was a child, I'm interested about all medical things. I dreamed to become a doctor. My aunt worked in a hospital, she told me a lot of things about her job and the life in a hospital. I loved watch Grey's Anatomy on TV all  weekend. I found the world of the hospital very attractive.
But when I started courses of mathematics and physics at school I realized that I like these topics and I wanted to do my job in this area. So I searched for studies and careers to join medicine things and mathematics or physics. I found the job of biomedical engineer on the web, it is a person who searches and develops all medical products.
Then I searched for studies for doing this job and I found the branch engineering for the health at ESIR. For my studies I did an internship at the hospital of Paris, I met a lot of people and particularly my internship mentor Alex Dupont, an engineer at the hospital. He teached me a lot of knowledge, thanks to him I discovered all the medical organizations and I saw in real life the job I want to do. He told me not only the good of the job and particularly the difficulties to work in a hospital against work in a company. He made me think about my professional project and helped me to know more precisely where I want to work and where I don't want.
To conclude my internship mentor is not my inspiration for the choice of my studies but he helped me a lot in the work of the definition of my professional project.
Thank you for reading.
Alex Dupont
